content: The beauty of nature. Smiles on a baby’s face. The kindness of strangers. The sounds of rain on the roof. A phone call or email from a friend, especially when it has been some time since I heard from that friend. Laughter from adults; giggles from children. A hug! Sharing what I have with others… Giving someone HOPE through a smile, a kind word, advice, whatever. Reading inspirational stories written by others. When a student “gets it.” When my husband says “you look great.” I’m of a certain age where the lines on my face show and I sometimes think of myself as the Saggy Baggy Elephant, even though I’m not overweight. I could go on and on….but that’s enough. Please notice that money is NOT listed here. I have enough to have a comfortable life — not really rich, but not poor-either. I have enough $ to give away to others whose life circumstances is not as good as my own. THAT makes me both blessed and joyful. So glad you asked this question, Jessica. Maybe you’ll get hundreds of answers to your query!!!
